Sent: Monday, February 26, 2007 10:15 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Remote pairing



There once was a quite good Eclipse plugin that allowed to work in 
shared editors, each participant having his own cursor. It was quite 
cool and effective, but it seems to have vanished... :(

David Saff schrieb:
> All,
> 
> A good chunk of the development work among committers on the JUnit
> project these days is done by pair-programming remotely. The problem
> is that most of the solutions we've come across (VNC, Citrix,
> Microsoft) are either too sluggish to present the ideal illusion that
> we are sharing the same instance of Eclipse, or don't play well with
> the firewalls on our personal networks. Has anyone tried a remote
> pair-programming solution that they were 100% happy with? Thanks,
> 
> David Saff
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Yahoo! Groups Links
> 
> 
> 
>
